response_parsed.title: Implementing Batch Jobs Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides a comprehensive walkthrough on implementing batch jobs using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understanding the concept of FastAPI and its support for asynchronous programming
Setting up a new FastAPI project with Python 3.12+
Designing an API endpoint to accept batch job submissions
Creating a worker function to process each job concurrently
Using Queue, ThreadPoolExecutor or ProcessPoolExecutor for handling multiple jobs
Managing job status and results through a database or in-memory data structure
version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required to take advantage of new features and performance improvements in FastAPI.
Some examples make use of the async/await syntax introduced in Python 3.7.
caveats: Ensure that you handle exceptions and error cases gracefully when processing jobs concurrently.
Optimize your job processing logic to scale effectively as the number of concurrent jobs increases.
Consider using a database or durable message queue for persisting job status and results.
